website_summaries.verdict: An entry-level saxophone with an assortment of accessories to get you started.
pros: Made with more than 300 handcrafted parts
Leather pads with metal tone boosters
Contoured keys with faux mother-of-pearl inlays
Includes hard-shell case, mouthpiece, neck strap, box of reeds, cleaning accessories, and more
cons: May arrive with loose keys, which can be tightened at home

customer_reviews.title: This has been perfect. We had a few issues but all were ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Sax in 2014 for my then 6th grade daughter. I didn't want to spent a ton of money on something I wasn't sure she was going to follow through with. 3 years later and she is 1st chair in the Advanced/Jazz band! This has been perfect. We had a few issues but all were minor. Now I'm going to purchase another for my son who is entering the 6th grade. It's perfect for a student(teach them to handle it with care....the metal is soft and the keys can bend easily) But it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Toothfairy

customer_reviews.title: Hoping this was just a returned item restocked by accident
customer_reviews.text: Hoping this was just a returned item restocked by accident. Some one used this and abused it! I will update after replacement arrives. There is not a single part not damaged my son is devastated he starts band auditions tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Millsap-Unger

customer_reviews.title: This purchase will be a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my son who started beginning band this year. After a few weeks of receiving this, the neck piece that goes into the saxophone got stuck. We were able to take it out but now it's stuck again. After numerous attempt, we manage to take out the top part of the neck but it does not stay on anymore. It constantly falls off when my son is playing. It's already passed the return date and the help support time frame so we have it in the shop to have it fixed but they're not sure they can even fix it. This purchase will be a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Pang X.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value for money
customer_reviews.text: I was very infuriated with this seller when I received a shipment of broken saxophone, with all table keys in pieces and requiring repair and assembly. I was mad that someone in a wharehouse or store would put such damaged item in a box and ship to a customer! However, I was happy when I went through Amazon complaint process and received a replacement shipment. I have since been enjoying my NEW Mendini MAS-L+92D + PB E Flat Alto Saxophone. All is well that ends well!!
customer_reviews.author: Hyacinth Uzoma

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my son wanted to continue to rent his sax. The music store wanted an extra $1000 on top of the rental fee of almost $400 that I paid in the beginning of the year to keep the one he's been playing!! H3ll no!! I purchased this with a grain of salt and it sounds great and my son says it's easier to play certain notes than the other expensive one. I did purchase a new strap with padding for him because the strap hurt his neck, but that was like $20 so why not? He is happy with it and so am I.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fazzio

customer_reviews.title: Great product without the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Taking it out of the box and assembled was amazing. Product quality was great and it comes with everything you need to start playing. The case is fantastic and very durable, the only issue was with the neck strap didn't have cushion and the strap rubs on you neck. Other than that it's a great starter to intermediate instrument.
customer_reviews.author: MetalPetal

customer_reviews.title: Good construction
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the solid construction of this sax especially after reading the reviews. All the connecting rods are firm and do not shift while allowing ease of movement when playing the sax. All the pads are in place and seal well. the tone that comes from this sax is pretty good for an under $300 USD saxophone. I would recommend it for anyone who wants to learn the sax but doesn't desire to invest in one of the $2500 USD instruments. If I had to do it all over I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would give no stars. Damaged and defective right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this product with no stars if possible. The saxophone arrived on time but came out of the box damaged and defective. A couple pads were already about to come off. But the worst is that the octave key will not work, making several notes unplayable. I have contacted the seller for resolution to this situation. Will update review when I hear back from seller and receive a resolution to this matter. At this point I am very disappointed and very unsatisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this instrument is MUCH more than I expected; a great instrument.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say it is a "dislike" actually, but I wish they would have had a little better neck strap. Some have complained about the reeds. I have used both the reeds that came with it and also bought Vandoren reeds. The Vandoren reeds are great but (speaking as a novice now) I cannot tell that the reeds that came with the Sax are not good. I can't tell much difference. I like the sound. As a beginner, I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Gentleman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a Student getting into band!
customer_reviews.text: My son love this Sax, he a student and starting on a Band, got him this Sax after searching locally and online for a good started Sax without spending thousands of dollars, i also didn't wanted to rent and have that worry of loosing an almost 4k Sax. this Sax is great and IMO it sounds as good as a Yamaha one. I also upgraded the reeds to "Rico 2.5 reeds", that alone made a huge difference. I'm planing to buy the Yamaha 4C mouthpiece as well, have read a lot on that upgrade, but still great with the stock.
customer_reviews.author: Kensei's Garage

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: We are very impressed with this Saxophone. After a few great years playing guitar, piano and most recently drums, I wanted to pick up some brass to write harmony/melodies alongside my tunes. Amazon recommended this one, and I can now confirm the reviews...for a starter instrument this thing looks, feels, and sounds fantastic. Its comfortably heavy, no cheap or broken parts, and everything came clean, organized and quickly. I originally planned to start with a Soprano Sax but there just wasn't any quality starter ones in eyesight, so that will be my next investment! The reason behind my desire to play saxophone? Wayne Shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Become Ones own woodwind repair person!!!
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived it the alto sax looked and played great.After sitting and playing it occationaly the g# key needs adjustment so that the d e f key functions.Note the sax is a good value for the money...their autorized warrenty adjustment dealers need to be more established. Summed up go to hobbylobby buy small tools and learn sax repairs?"
customer_reviews.author: Duane Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Plays real easy
customer_reviews.text: Tight, easy to play, hits every note with ease. Sound is full and strong or soft and smooth. Yamaha 5C MPC, 2-2.5 reed. Update Oct. 11, 2017: Purchased on July 4, 2017. Passes the "pop" test, the sound the keys make when you close them quickly, kinda like popping the cork on a wine bottle only less so. If the pads aren't closing flat, they don't "pop". It's the same sound you get when you slap your mouth when it's open.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Good student axe.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sax for the money. It has a few small anomalies that I’ll bet they improve; 1) is palm keys are a little sharp and out of place. 2)some of the springs are very hard, like G sharp for instance which makes the low C# also tricky. 3)the octave key depresses too far. However Important things like sound, pitch and well seated pads were good. I had one pivot screw back out; The ‘G’. Even after some lubrication it backed out again. I took the sax to the Caribbean for a gig and it worked. My Mark VI is still being repaired. This is a very good student instrument for the money.
customer_reviews.author: David Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I got his for my 9 year old. I played sax in middle and high school and know my way around instruments. We got the Blue and Gold, everyone at school was very impressed. This is by no means a high end sax and don't expect to hit the highest or lowest notes but for what it cost it plays well and is perfect for kids or someone just starting out. The pads were decent quality and everything worked as it should.
customer_reviews.author: HasanMichael

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a saxophone quickly so I could give lessons at a music store. I nervously ordered this unit, but my fears were unfounded. The saxophone had acceptable, fluid action, the pads were all perfect, it has a quite nice tone and decent intonation--it's not a Selmer, but it competes with the Yamaha owned by the student I'm teaching. The included reeds were quality (this came with so many little extras, a very nice touch) and everything about it was a pleasant surprise from my expectations given the price. Delivery via Prime was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Not bad tone quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a practise saxophone to keep at home. It works great for this application. The cork was a little big, and the mouth piece it came with kinda sucked, but the instrument was fine for the money. My son says it is a little bit harder to play than his good one, but I told him that it will make him better. He loved the color, and honestly, with the Yamaha mouth piece we bought, its tone quality sounds pretty good when he is practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: ISO - Instrument Shaped Object
customer_reviews.text: I've read the horror stories about "pot" metal (metal that melts at a very low temp, is brittle, etc), leaky pads, and terrible construction, but I thought "Surely in 2018 it's not that bad". I was wrong. The pads on the sax I was shipped had extremely leaky pads, and it was missing half the accessories claimed in the bundle. It had a nice heft to it, didn't feel like a toy, but it certainly played like one. The only positive about this experience was the hassle free Amazon return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Willow

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful first saxophone for our daughter. Has great sound quality! You can't beat the price! It's better than a student horn. Thank you for selling a quality instrument at an affordable price. We love it! Her father is a music major and teaches saxophone and he can't believe the quality of this horn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This sax will give any beginner the tools they need to learn the instrument. I suggest investing immediately in new reeds and a new neck strap. If possible, a mouthpiece and ligature as well. If you do all that you'll still be under what most saxophones cost and you'll be much happier to pick this up and play. Useless items in the kit are the playing gloves, reeds, and music book. Best items are the sax, and the tuner.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The best student saxophone
customer_reviews.text: We had the saxophone tuned up and was told that “it is one of the best student saxophones” they have come across and that it was very easy to tune up.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Linda

customer_reviews.title: She was very excited to play her new sax and she was very pleased with the sound and how well the holes snap ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife on Mother's Day. Her Sax had been stolen years ago and she had not been able to replace it. She was very excited to play her new sax and she was very pleased with the sound and how well the holes snap shut. This is a beautiful instrument, and it sounds fantastic when she plays it. All notes play clear and full. For a beginner, or anyone really, this is a fantastic instrument. It feels, looks, and sounds way more expensive than it is. I think I may get myself the Tenor Sax to learn!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sax, but outdated user guide.
customer_reviews.text: The Mendini saxophone is great for beginners. I loved that it came equipped with all the essential accessories. The only negative thing that I noticed was the outdated instruction manual that was hard to follow (i.e. assembling, finger placement, and how to hold). I realize that there are many other resource outlets to obtain this information so it it didn’t feel too big of a concern from a personal standpoint. However, to whom it may concern: an updated user guide with colored, digital images would be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great horn for a beginner or a secondary instrument for fill in playing.
customer_reviews.text: The bag, horn and the majority of accessories are very high quality for the price. The only issue this horn had was a ligature that was purely flimsy at best. I didn't bother to make any calls, I just ordered a decent one for my Daughter so that she had exactly what she needed. That said, if the only thing wrong with this entire package is a bad ligature, then you know you have a great item!
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, so don't expect the best thing ever. I'm a beginner, and this seems like it will get me going for at least a year. There are a couple of issues, the spring on the G# key is a little weak, the low C pad doesn't seem to totally seal and some other key doesn't stay shut (alt F# key I think?). But even knowing these, I would make the purchase again so that I'll know what to look for when I go to buy a more expensive horn in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brigham Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this sax 2 weeks ago. None of the top keys work and only the bottom 3 would work. No matter what I did, there was no sound or better yet nothing but sqeeks coming in. Very disappointed and will never purchase any other instruments on Amazon or online. It will prob cost me a fortune to bring it in to a local music store to have them take a look at the pads and why it doesn't play.
customer_reviews.author: Yengmengpao A. Ly

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This is really a cheap sax. I bought this for my sixth grader a year ago so I wouldn’t have to buy an expensive sax or continue renting. The new school year started and we are back to renting. He never felt that he got very good sound from it, but he was only ten/eleven years old, so I didn’t think much of it. Then the music teacher told me it needed repair. When I saw the problem was actually the instrument itself, I knew repair would cost more than it was worth. 😢 I do not recommend this for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend its purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a mediocre instrument which plays and tunes poorly. I would not recommend its purchase. Better to buy a used yamaha or jupiter and not suffer the grief. Of course if you can afford a new instrument, all the more power to you. Save your money!! Don't buy this saxophone.
customer_reviews.author: jon from ohio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect instrument for a beginner alto player
customer_reviews.text: Perfect instrument for a beginner alto player. My son is very happy it came with a finger chart. It is also helping me remember how to play it so I can help teach him when he's home. The tuner is great, and I love that it comes with everything it does. Very good condition, couldn't have asked for better!
customer_reviews.author: SpooningBadger

customer_reviews.title: My saxophone was defective and I had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a perfectly fine lime green Mendini clarinet and gave the brand the benefit of the doubt—but the lowest key made the sax play in a higher octave though I didn’t press the octave key. I thought that perhaps I’m just bad at playing saxophone but taking it to a music shop to inspect furthermore, it indeed was flawed & the key wouldn’t seal to play the proper note. It’s unfortunate because it was a beautiful instrument but didn’t play correctly. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Selena Savage

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I went ahead and purchased this instrument instead of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saxophone for my 6th grade kid that decided to try band this year and picked an expensive instrument. I was hesitant to buy this after reading some of the reviews about build quality and sound quality. I am glad I went ahead and purchased this instrument instead of leasing. She is halfway through the school year and the sax has performed flawlessly. The sound is good enough for her and the sixth grade band and it has remained a good looking instrument. Go ahead and get this for your 1st year student. You can buy an expensive instrument if the interest continues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plays beautifully, great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical to buy a sax online and for the price My son is entering middle school and playing Alto Sax 1 1/2 years. The brass color one he picked is great, it plays beautifully with great sound and my son absolutely loves it ! The case and all the extras it comes with is a great bonus Sax rental was pricey, so it pays for itself just him playing one year. We did buy him a better, more comfortable neck strap, the one it came with was not comfortable for him, that's been his only complaint
customer_reviews.author: Lynreil

customer_reviews.title: Octave key is not located correctly
customer_reviews.text: The octave key is not positioned in the correct location , the saxophone body seems to be okay enough , how ever all its components suck as the attachments for the keys are extremely cheap . It’s a struggle to get good notes from the instrument . This sax won’t in my opinion no matter how careful you are with it will not last long .
customer_reviews.author: Lisortiz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product & Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Trust me when I say I NEVER write reviews but wanted to help the next person out! This product is probably the best bang for your buck! Definitely a top notch starter Saxophone for beginners or who those who want to get back in the game. It comes with A LOT of goodies such as 2.5 reeds, metronome & tuner, neck strap, music pocketbook, ligature & mouth piece already assembled, cleaning cloth, & gloves! Everything you need to get started! The only thing I would say is the sound is good, but using the octave key got a little weird and hitting the lower notes compromised sound quality a bit but nothing major! Overall a really solid product!
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a 10 year old for his first instrument. It was a great alternative to renting an expensive instrument from the local music store. It is a good quality saxophone and sounds great. The case is nice, and much lighter than his friends' saxophone cases. We also had a great experience with the seller, KK Music Store. We had a small defective part on a trombone we bought for our daughter. They replaced the entire slide free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: dealscavenger

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used item, tried to sell as New
customer_reviews.text: ordered this and it arrived very obviously used, the mouthpiece was put together and dirty, the sax itself was dirty and sticky, the package of reeds was open with one also broken and the neck strap was still attached. I ordered a replacement, and will update if my new item arrives. The photo shows where they cut out the address label to the last place it was sent.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy with the product and the service provided by store
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son to use for his 4th grade band a year ago. His is still using it and it has been working out well for him. Shortly after he received it. Something was wrong with the neck of the saxophone. I wrote to the company and they replaced it free of charge and quickly with an apology. So far very happy with the product and the service provided by store. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 4

customer_reviews.title: Already paid for itself in savings on sax rental fees!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this saxophone has been great! The best part: It's already paid for itself by not having to rent an overpriced crappy saxophone from a music store!! It's been well taken care of and stored in the included case. Used by a 5th-grader for months and haven't had any problems. Even if it eventually breaks, it's already been cheaper than renting, so no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: River Dalton

customer_reviews.title: My Son Said "Don't Say Anything Negative...It's Great!"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saxophone for my son. I know nothing about them but this looked like it had everything he would need to start learning. He's had it about a month now so I called and asked how he likes it because I wanted to write a review. He said "Don't say anything negative....it's great!" He said it is perfect for a beginning and it looks great (apparently there is pretty engraving on it) and it sounds good. He is really happy with it and he said everything he needed came with it.
customer_reviews.author: EDH

customer_reviews.title: Came with defects  - buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product will play for about a month before it's problems become apparent. The octave key extends down so low that it sticks against the top post unless you neck is turned away at a 30 degree angle. The low register B flat to D# does not play and the C1 - C2 B flat to D# also does not play. I can find a replacement neck but issues with the keys require professional repair.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Breath sound and look
customer_reviews.text: Is very eye captivating in the blue and gold and sounds great. Had an issue with the ligature that came with it being too big, but a quick phone call to the seller and I had a new one mailed to me quickly. Seller was very considerate and helpful and I would recommend both them and this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Julia M

customer_reviews.title: What a POS
customer_reviews.text: My teenage daughter started beginning band this year, I thought I would be doing her a favor by buying her a sax instead of renting one. There were parts falling off when we received it which I was able to reattach and she's been playing for a few months now and decided to try jazz band. We've now discovered that the keys aren't arranged properly and there are a whole range of notes she can't even play, something the teacher has seen before from this brand. I just got home from the local music store where I rented a sax that actually works. DO NOT BUY ONE OF THESE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not sure...
customer_reviews.text: Everything was in a white bag except the mouth piece. It looks used and had marks on it. Also some keys have this weird substance that marked them. It seems this was used and returned which is unsanitary. Deciding what to do next since this was a birthday gift that is on the 17th. 💔
customer_reviews.author: Lali

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great instrument! I recieved everything that is supposed to come with it. The sounds is good. I'm a clarinet player but got this Saxophone for my 11 year old son. There were no manufacturing defects. I highly recommend this as its cheaper to get this than to even rent.
customer_reviews.author: Nisla

customer_reviews.title: A Beautiful Instrument, It Sounds Fantastic All I Need Now ...
customer_reviews.text: A Beautiful Instrument,It Sounds Fantastic All I Need Now Is Lesson's(Lol).It Arrived On Time As Stated And The Package And Didn't Have Any Rips In It.I Would Highly Recommend Buying Any Instrument's From This Class Act Company "Cecilio",And I Would Buy From Them Again.A Very Happy Customer Again,Thank You Cecilio Musical Instruments & Amazon
customer_reviews.author: James A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in price but not quality.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good. Is cheap in price but not quality. You can tell in certain areas where they cut costs but it really isn’t in any important parts meaning that this instrument can sound great if played right. I’m a beginner and have had it for 3 days and just learned my first song.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: I think this kit is great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I think this kit is great for the money. Seems like everything you would need is included except some music. I think this Alto saxaphone looks and feels like a good quality piece (not an expert opinion though). I just played this instrument from Elementary to early high school and now I just want to occasionally practice keying and tooting some basic music. Therefore this fits me very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything needed was in the package.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Sax for our ten year old son for Christmas. He loves it. It works wonderfully! He takes lessons with it and we have not had any issues at all. We are 100% happy with the quality as well!
customer_reviews.author: Taresa Suitor

customer_reviews.title: Just Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing for 30 years, got this horn for my kids and I cannot get a decent note below C. I even returned it hoping I just got a horn with a leak- but nope the 2nd one came and can't play a darn thing below C. Returning that one too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Habicht

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sax
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. Was skeptical being a Chinese product. BUT...I was very supprised on the craftmanship of this Sax. Very sturdy. Intonation dead on from low Bb to high F#. Great tone. Great action. No leaky pads. Neededno adjustments on arrival. Packaging was perfect. Absolutely no dissapointments. Sounds just as good as the Yamaha YAS23. Great sturdy case. Throw the mouth piece in the garbage and get a Yamaha 4C, and you will have an amazing sounding Sax.
customer_reviews.author: waterboy1972

customer_reviews.title: Nothing played with the octave key is on correct pitch
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first horn from the Amazon Warehouse after almost 12 years out of playing. First impression was that it seemed to have a hard time moving air but at a little over a hundred dollars, not a bad deal. I had a hunch that some of the notes were just a little off key. Didn't realize how far off it was until I compared the notes with another sax a few months later. When I called the Cecilio's (manufacturer), I was told that because it wasn't purchased new, they weren't going to do anything about it. Fairly disappointing welcome back to the instrument. Pass on this one and get something a bit higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shuakym

customer_reviews.title: No protection
customer_reviews.text: The bag’s zipper was broken off, but shipping box appeared ok. Need this for grandson’s band class, so not time to return. There should be bubble wrap around the bag in the shipping box. No protection whatsoever between the bag and shipping box. This is a soft bag, not a hard case. Hope the instrument will be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m Seeing Red!!!
customer_reviews.text: This saxophone stopped working after 3 months of use. The sounds were awful and my grandchild had to miss several band classes because it is defective. It cost me $61.00 to send it back to the manufacturer because they won’t pay for returns. I’m out of a lot of money and the Sax. I’m highly upset. I would rate this a zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for the best but the more I inspect the Sax, the more I get disappointed. Brand New out of the box and its already missing pearl covers. Well, fake pearl plastic covers. I don't want to keep inspecting because I may return it.
customer_reviews.author: helpful 4 u

customer_reviews.title: Keys don't work
customer_reviews.text: This was an absolutely terrible saxophone. I would not recommend it to anybody, not even beginners. First off, the keys are really out of tune and are basically unfixable. The lower register keys also don't work at all, like the Db, Cb, C, B, and Bb keys. The instrument itself also feels like it was completely made out of poor quality materials. Not good at all! Right now, I am talking with the manufacturer and hoping that I can return it and get a full refund because this was a complete waste of my money. DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: So my dear old expensive saxophone that owes me nothing since I bought it second hand over twenty years ago and it has been played endlessly decided to give up and to get it fixed was going to cost a lot of money with no guarantee so I bought this gorgeous one as a fill in for my band with no real expectations for the price but it arrived this morning and I’m loving it so far! Easy to blow, OK tone (I did put my own reed in)! For the price I would say go for it if you are a beginner or just wanting a spare one! The ligature is a bit loose but nothing serious!
customer_reviews.author: MarylouR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The sax is gorgeous, it plays great and the quality is excellent. The case is well made and has room for extra items. The included tuner metronome is great and really helps with practicing. The included cork grease and cleaning cloth are great too! I highly recommend this sax for beginners and experienced sax players who want a nice sax and don't want to spend a fortune. I give it an A+
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: once again, Cecilio impresses! We have ordered a full size trumpet, and pocket trumpet from Cecilio in the past and have been really impressed with the quality to price ratio. No this is not a professional Saxophone, but for someone just wanting to dip their toes into a new (and generally very expensive) instrument this is a great way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Downey

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used this for 2 years now perfect for a starter
customer_reviews.author: gwen garcia

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, Customer service no help
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Customer service won't take it back after 30 days and because I ordered through Amazon.... "There's no way we can take it back" really? This sax maskes a horrible blast of a noise and can't make notes. Now I'm stuck with a $200 worthless instrument.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Whatever you do don’t purchase this saxophone. Save your money and buy from a better source. The sax I got looked heavily used and I wish I would have taken photos to prove. The thing that got to me was that one of the keys wasn’t working, apparently they check their saxes before selling....yeah right. Yes you get all these extra accessories, but it’s definitely a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Abram guerra

customer_reviews.title: fell apart on the second day.
customer_reviews.text: The sound was not bad for the price, but the instrument its self was falling apart the second day I was playing it. I am a fairly experienced player, and I have to say I expected a lot more with all the positive reviews on this product. Don't waste your money. Maybe mine was simply a defect who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal! Not only for just a saxophone but it comes with many accessories. We were paying monthly for a saxophone from a store through school. We paid $50/month all last school year until I found this! It's not amazing quality like the $4,000 one we rented but it's good enough for my 5th graders lessons at school.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: Missing buttons
customer_reviews.text: Pieces of instrument missing! Just received it. Need it by Wednesday and it’s Monday!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it, spend a little more
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has had this horn for a year. And it has had to be worked on to much I'm not sure if I could not have saved on a more reputable brand. This is junk, every instrument I've purchased od this brand has been junk.
customer_reviews.author: Nico & Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for first time player!
customer_reviews.text: For my first-time 6th grader this instrument is perfect! Maybe the sound quality is more of a player issue rather than this saxophone haha. But I honestly recommend if you can't rent one.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Vega

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price also sounds good
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price also sounds good. Only one small problem there was a key that was sticking.was able to fix it with the help of a friend.
customer_reviews.author: digit5

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Very well built saxophone with remarkable tone and intonation. The price was definitely right. Now just getting my grandson to practice...that will be the problem!
customer_reviews.author: Robin D.C.

customer_reviews.title: He says it's beautiful and he loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my nephew who is a music student. He says it's beautiful and he loves it. I never saw it or heard it play yet so I take his word for it but he sounded very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Asie Arkhurst

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, don't buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this saxophone. I purchased the sax on 9/14/19, my daughter plays this sax on a limited basis, and it's already in need of a $150 repair. Save your money and buy a better sax! The finish is already peeling off in places, the repair shop won't warranty work on the horn and I've been having instruments repaired with them for over 14 years.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very good instrument and accessory bundle for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very good instrument for the money, ... my wife loves it. It's easy to play and we bought this alto sax as the soprano sax was just to hard to learn. Everything comes with it and again for the money this is a great deal. The saxophone looks sharp and sounds pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: scherfcom

customer_reviews.title: Great starter sax
customer_reviews.text: This sax was a great low cost option to try out the sax. It's not perfect, but for the price it's a steal. After eight months of use I upgraded to a like-new YAS-23. My biggest complaint was that the Bb/alt C/high F group of keys is too high. I didn't really notice that this was a problem until I got my YAS-23 and I didn't have to move my hand to use the alt C lol
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner sax but would not recommend for long term use.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first saxophone. It is great for a beginner sax but I would not recommend it for anyone who is at a more advanced level. The metal is cheap and dents quite easily and the sound quality is sub-par. Great for learning but not for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler K

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son in red. The set included everything he needed to get started in band including the reeds. I'm pleasantly surprised by how attractive the saxophone is. The colors choices are fun and my son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Held captive

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saxophone, attempting to get back into music. Fresh out of the box the keys were broken, leaking pads, and a damaged bore which allowed ZERO sound to be played at all, I even took it to a music shop and they started it was unusable, IMMEDIATE RETURN for sure, do not buy instraments online.
customer_reviews.author: janell conley

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: For twice the cost of a 6 month rental from the school's recommended source he gets to keep it forever. Easy to maintain and works great for a beginner student. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great sax I recomend it.
customer_reviews.text: While most sax's have to be set up this instrument came ready to play. Great instrument. I am glad I ordered it. I would put it in the same level as Jupiter brands. This is very affordable for the beginner and student. I have several Mendini products and never an issue.
customer_reviews.author: curious

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent practice Sax. We did have to purchase a different mouthpiece and reeds to improve the sound. Still good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom5

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I admit that, while I am a professional musician, I am NOT a true sax player. However, I must say, the instrument performs and sounds wonderful. Great tone and ease of playing makes the instrument fun. The lacquer finish is beautiful and the gold pads accent the color in a way that creates the 'wow' factor when people see it. The case is durable, the accessories seem about complete. The only thing I went out and bought was a new neck strap, as the one that came with it felt rather sharp and scratchy. I bought a nicely padded one. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Al Musitano

customer_reviews.title: Daughter's Saxophone
customer_reviews.text: I got my daughter this saxophone. She is in her first year of band, going onto her second. At first the sax was a bit hard to play, notes not coming out right. After some playing, it sounded pretty good . So, yes. I do recommend buying this sax.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa M

customer_reviews.title: Good as long as it doesn't need fixing
customer_reviews.text: My son is happy because the color of course makes a different but you can see the little details of areas without paint, now when my son play on it he said the D key leaks and this leak cost my another $128 of fixing because this brand has not spare pieces so they need to be hand made, so after all is to so cheap..
customer_reviews.author: Dayana Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a beginner sax for my 6th grader. We’ve had it about 6 months and no concerns or problems. Comes with a great case which gave me relief since she’s packing it back and forth to school. Accessories are a great bonus too! If you’re looking for a great starter sax this is the way to go 100%!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Best sax for the money
customer_reviews.text: I played the sax when I was in grade school and always regretted giving it up because renting one was just too expensive for my parents at the time. 18 years later and 1:00 A.M. I decided to give it another try because this was so affordable. It isn’t a $1000 to $8000 sax but I’ll tell u it is definitely worth $250. I picked it up and got right back at it like I never stopped. Went to the music store and bought a good book. It is really well crafted and sounds great for the money
customer_reviews.author: michael g glaser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a begginer or not totally dedicated
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who is in band. Got it his freahman year he is a junior now. It still looms and sounds great. It has only had to be serviced once. Given how much it gets played it is awesome. Great value. And a descent instrument. Not top of the line. But if you are on a budget or don't know if your kid will stick with it. This is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and sound plus price, thanks 🙏
customer_reviews.text: I don't play the instrument by profession but I play since I was very young and I can say that has nothing to envy to so many brands out there with prices that triple this price. No many sellers would be to happy with Mendini in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: The main complaints that I have is that i received this item, used, under the pretense that it was in great condition with only minor markings. However, it must have been dropped badly by the previous owner. The octave key was bent badly and so the instrument only played the upper end of its range and there was a piece broken/dislodged that rendered one note impossible to play. One of the black wire pieces that hold certain keys in place; I’m not familiar enough to know the name. Also, a screw on the neck was broken so it’s a little loose. Better advertisement on product condition condition or better inspection is recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Peacock Jr

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect this saxophone to last for more then 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sax for my son on June 3, 2018 when he started band in Middle school, it is now Nov 4, 2019, the sax still works but has been slowly falling apart, i've had it repaired a couple times but pieces are just starting to come off and is being held together with glue. I went this route because I wanted to make sure my son really wanted to play and didn't give up after Middle school. He is now in high school marching band and concert band. He now has a Yamaha saxophone and is loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Robertson Cabrales

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sax for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have never played an instrument so I didn't want to spend a lot of money. Read the reviews and bought the Mendini Alto Sax. I love it looks great and sounds great. My friend has played the Sax for 20 years and said for the price it sounds decent. Well it's been six months and it is still holding up to my practice and playing everyday.
customer_reviews.author: MCBasham

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beginners or local municipal band members. I now have a collection of saxophones and a flute and the variety of colors are making our municipal band look pretty cool! Buy your own reeds and neck strap but the horns are pretty awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.author: M. Selep

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I was secpticical at first, but after reading the reviews and looking at the over all ratings I said," What the heck?" and I was surprised it was amazing quality. The only thing I don't like it the gloves are not well made and very thin, However the best sax for a grate price.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Gronnel

customer_reviews.title: However it is functional and is good starter horn for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the instrument is what you would expect for the price you pay. However it is functional and is good starter horn for a beginner. Cheaper than renting an instrument.
customer_reviews.author: LakeLady

customer_reviews.title: Not a good quality instrument
customer_reviews.text: This product is good for its price but won’t last you long. After the first few months of playing, it started to break down and wouldn’t play certain notes even if you knew you did it right. I feel like you should buy this saxophone and use it as a placeholder while you buy a better quality brand of saxophone. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Maney

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My son just joined the band and his teacher wanted us to purchase a $1500 sax and I decided to look on here for something similar! He said it was close enough and my son says it’s great! He loves that he’s the only one with a silver one!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Some of the welds aren't perfect, but I'm not buying for a professional
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely can not beat the price. I paid the same for a 10+ year old used one for another one of my kids. Would buy again in a heartbeat. Some of the welds aren't perfect, but I'm not buying for a professional.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous instrument...lots of issues
customer_reviews.text: This alto Saxophone is gorgeous! Having a hard time getting the mouthpiece on and octive key was bent. Wouldn't hit certain notes. Had a professional look it over and they said it was not made well and would cost me in the end. So disappointed because the reviews were pretty good and the instrument is absolutely beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Foxj

customer_reviews.title: Good price for all that came with the saxophone
customer_reviews.text: Good price for all that came with the saxophone, i didnt have to come out of pocket for the suggested Yamaha the band leaders recommended. It plays the same to me, the saxophone is of good quality
customer_reviews.author: Nick Williamsen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: First one we ordered had a loose octave key. Replacement had a broken wire that secured another key.
customer_reviews.author: Watkins Family

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying this based on some of the reviews. This saxophone has a good sound, and is easy for our son to play. We are pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: We have received heavy used item.
customer_reviews.text: We have received heavy used item. Might be sax itself is ok, when new and working, but our was used, with wrong mouthpeice, rust, dents, scratches and bends on some details. This really gave bad impression to myself and my son.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner student
customer_reviews.text: My son played this Saxophone for 2 years (5th and 6th grade). It was WAY cheaper than renting and the perfect instrument for a child starting out. Moving onto a Yamaha YAS-23 now for the next step. But no regrets here.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferManwaring

product_meta.title: Mendini by Cecilio E-Flat Alto Saxophone, Gold Lacquered + Tuner, Case, Pocketbook - MAS-L+92D+PB
product_meta.description: Color:Gold LacquerTeacher approved, Mendini saxophones are the perfect instruments for the student musicians and a great addition to any level players. The large bore makes it easy for young players to get a great, full bodied sound and the fast action keys allow for easy playability for all players. The tone is deep and rich with even intonation throughout the full range. Each instrument is assembled with over 300 hand crafted parts that are all made exclusively by Cecilio. There are no off the shelf parts. Every saxophone is play tested at Cecilio's factory and re-tested at their Los Angeles distribution center to ensure that their high quality standards are met. This is why thousands of instructors have approved these saxophones. Package includes: a plush lined nylon covered hard case with backpack strap and zippered pocket, a neck strap, a mouthpiece with reed and cap, a box of 10 reeds (size 2.5"), a polishing cloth, cleaning rod, and a pair of white gloves to keep your instruments spot free when being played. Buy with confidence as it comes with a 1- year warranty against any manufacturer's defects.
feature_bullets: Gold lacquered body and keys Eb alto sax
Rib construction, stainless steel springs, quality leather pads, metal resonators
Includes: tuner, mouthpiece with ligature, hard case, box of 2.5 reeds, neck strap, cleaning rod, polishing cloth, a pair of gloves and pocketbook

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,547 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
